completed_at.description: The ISO8601 timestamp when the export was completed.

contact_count.description: The total number of exported contacts.

created_at.description: The ISO8601 timestamp when the export was begun.

expires_at.description: The ISO8601 timestamp when the exported file on S3 will expire.

message.description: A human readable message if the status is `failure`.

updated_at.description: The ISO8601 timestamp when the export was updated.

urls.description: One or more download URLs for the contact file if the status is `ready`.

finished_at.description: The ISO8601 timestamp when the job was finished.

job_type.description: The job type. Allowed values: `upsert`, or `delete`.

results.description: Result map of the import job.

started_at.description: The ISO8601 timestamp when the job was created.

status.description: The job state. Allowed values: `pending`, `completed`, `errored`, or `failed`.

ContactImportResults.description: Result map of the import job.

created_count.description: Created contact count from the import.

deleted_count.description: Count of deleted contacts that resulted in error.

errored_count.description: Count of imported contacts that resulted in error.

errors_url.description: The download URL of the file which provides information about any errors.

requested_count.description: Requested contact count from the import.

updated_count.description: Updated contact count from the import.

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address.

address_line_2.description: An optional second line for the address.

alternate_emails.description: Additional emails associated with the contact.

country.description: The contact's country. Can be a full name or an abbreviation.

custom_fields.description: An object of custom field IDs and the values you want to associate with those custom fields. You can retrieve the IDs of your custom fields from the [Get All Field Definitions endpoint](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/custom-fields/get-all-field-definitions).

email.description: The contact's primary email. This is required to be a valid email.

phone_number_id.description: The contact's Phone Number ID. This must be a valid phone number.

postal_code.description: The contact's ZIP code or other postal code.

state_province_region.description: The contact's state, province, or region.

ContactRequestCustomFields.description: An object of custom field IDs and the values you want to associate with those custom fields. You can retrieve the IDs of your custom fields from the [Get All Field Definitions endpoint](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/custom-fields/get-all-field-definitions).

w1.description: The properties in this object are made up of a key (the custom field ID) and value you want associated with that custom field. For example `{"w1": "coffee"}`.

identifier_value.description: The value of the identifier you want to remove from the contact.

DeleteContactIdentifierResult.description: Indicates that the deletion is queued for processing. Check the job status with the Import Contacts Status endpoint.

DeleteContactResult.description: The deletion job has been accepted and is being processed.

list_ids.description: IDs of the contact lists you want to export.

max_file_size.description: The maximum size of an export file in MB. Note that when this option is specified, multiple output files may be returned from the export.

segment_ids.description: IDs of the contact segments you want to export.

id.description: The ID of the export job.

identifiers.description: One or more more identifier values to search for in your Marketing Campaigns contacts.

GetContactByIdentifiersResult.description: An object containing one or more of the identifiers matching the searched identifiers in your contacts.

field_mappings.description: Import file header to reserved/custom field mapping.

list_ids.description: All contacts will be added to each of the specified lists.

job_id.description: The ID of the import job.

upload_headers.description: A list of headers that must be included in PUT request.

upload_uri.description: The URI to PUT the upload file to.

emails.description: One or more primary and/or alternate email addresses to search for in your Marketing Campaigns contacts.

phone_number_id.description: The contact's Phone Number ID. This is required to be a valid phone number.

ListContactByEmailResult.description: An object containing one or more of the email addresses matching the searched addresses in your contacts.

billable_breakdown.description: `billable_breakdown` will only appear to the parent user in an account with subusers.

billable_count.description: The count of contacts this month for billing purposes.

ListContactCountResultBillableBreakdown.description: `billable_breakdown` will only appear to the parent user in an account with subusers.

breakdown.description: A map of each subuser's billable contact usage. Each key is the subuser's ID and each value is the usage thus far this month.

total.description: The sum of all the subuser's billable contacts

completed_at.description: This ISO8601 timestamp when the export was completed.

created_at.description: This ISO8601 timestamp when the export was created.

expires_at.description: This ISO8601 timestamp when the export expires.

urls.description: One or more download URLs for the contact file(s) if the status is `ready`.

count.description: The number of items in the entire list, i.e., across all pages.

next.description: The URL of the next page of results. If this field isn't present, you're at the end of the list.

prev.description: The URL of the previous page of results. If this field isn't present, you're at the start of the list.

self.description: The URL of the current page of results.

query.description: An SGQL search string or other pattern.

contact_count.description: The total number of contacts matched.

contacts.description: One or more contacts objects that you intend to upsert. Each contact needs to include at least one of `email`, `phone_number_id`, `external_id`, or `anonymous_id` as an identifier.

list_ids.description: An array of List ID strings that this contact will be added to.

job_id.description: Indicates that the contacts are queued for processing. Check the job status with the "Import Contacts Status" endpoint.

delete_all_contacts.description: Must be set to `"true"` to delete all contacts.

ids.description: A comma-separated list of contact IDs.

contact_id.description: Must be set to the `contact_id` of the contact you want to remove the identifier from.

identifier_type.description: The type of identifier to search for.
